content.description: Trident has nice, steep wall climbing on big holds by Quarry standards. Per Ron Birk, this climb may have been filled in and not accessible any longer.
content.location: This is on the second buttress from the left. The route begins on the lower right side, move left and then finishes straight up. It is pretty sustained.

content.description: Follow the easiest-looking line of weakness slightly diagonally up a series of small ledges/edges between some large, drilled-out cylinder things. The drilling offers some satisfying sidepulls if you can find 'em.
content.protection: A TR off a tree/fencepost anchor is possible.
content.location: Start maybe 5' left of the slab, up a section with climbable-looking, small ledges.

content.description: Tricky start leads to sharp ledges and to the top. Several options exist.
content.protection: The blocks on top of this route moves a little with pressure, so think about it when building a top rope anchor.
content.location: This is in the middle of the face, right of the arete on the north wall.

content.description: Climb face up using small sharp ledges. Several options exist.
content.protection: The blocks on top of this route moves a little with pressure, so think about it when building a top rope anchor.
content.location: This is just right of the arete on the north wall.

content.description: Follow the arete to the top.
content.location: This ascends the prominent arete on the north wall.

content.description: Climb the slab (not using the left wall) till the bigm blocky overhang. Reach up, heel hookm and work your way up. It is tricky and pumpy.
content.location: It goes under the big, blocky overhang at the north wall.

content.description: Follow a vertical crack to the top.
content.location: It ascends the vertical crack on the north wall.

content.description: Stem on paint and granite, and maybe find an underling. Top out on the ledge, or do a few more moves to the top If you want.
content.protection: TR off a tree / boulder / random metal shit anchor.
content.location: It is the leftmost route on Swingles North wall, I think, in a dehedral just left of the diagonal hand crack.

content.description: Climb using some nice hands/smallhands/finger locks or laybacking possible up this short cracky crack to a ledge. Continue with a few more moves to the top, if you want.
content.protection: You can use trees, a boulder, gear, or random quarry metal for possible TR anchor.
content.location: It ascends a short, diagonal hand crack just right of the corner, at the left end of Swingle's North wall.

content.description: Climb left of arete, follow the ramp, and finish on Finger Flux.
content.location: It is just left of the arete on the north wall.

content.description: Follow a slab (with lots of small ledges) to the top.
content.protection: Get good pro along the left crack.
content.location: It ascends the slab left of the big overhang.

content.description: Climb left side / corner to the top with big blocks.
content.location: It is on the left side under the big, blocky overhang at the north wall.

content.description: Big Flake goes up the flake / ramp and traverses left. It is very easy.
content.location: It is on the left side of the north wall, by the right-facing corner / flake.

content.description:
This used to be the Mother of all the Quarries, water, death, and craziness. Now filled in, it boasts pretty high walls by Quarry standards and some cool climbing. Most of the climbs are nice and sunny. Per Ron Birk, since the quarries were filled in, these walls were reduced in height from about 75 to 30 feet.

 L->R:

 A. [Swingle's South Wall]]118859148, 9, 1p, 20', TR. B. Dark Man Slab, 2, 1p, gear. C. Sprax's Long Night, A0, 1p, 25', TR. D. Dihedral (?), 7, 1p, 12', TR. E. Diagonal Hand Crack (?), 1p, TR. F. Big Flake, 3, 1p, TR. G1. Finger Flux, 10, 1p, TR. G2. Diagon Ally, 10, 1p, TR. H. Swingle's Arete, 6, 1p, TR. I. Swingle's North Wall - Left, 6, 1p, TR. J. Swingle's North Wall - Right, 8, 1p, TR. K. Chipmunk Swingle, 4, 1p, TR. L. Monkey Swingle, 10, 1p, TR.

 ? Sprax's Long Night, A0, 1p, 25'. ?. Trident, 10, 1p, 60', TR.
